node.title: Terrible, awful and a disaster: Kiwis sum up 2021 in one word
node.description: The public has a few things to say about the year marred by COVID.
node.content: ["'Challenging', 'messy', 'terrible' and a 'disaster'.", "These are just some of the answers from a survey asking Kiwis how they would sum up 2021 in one word.", "Talbot Mills Research asked Kiwis which one word would they use to describe the year that's been.", "The most common ones were 'shit', 'rollercoaster', 'terrible', 'challenging', 'shitshow', 'messy', 'disaster', and 'clusterf**k'. Amazingly, someone said 'great'.", "But the bar is so low this year, it's basically on the ground. One Kiwi told Newshub the year was 'amazing', because they got a part-time job.", "Yes, in the year that's been, just getting a part-time job is considered amazing.", "And unless you've been in a two year-long induced coma, you'll know why it has been such a crap year. Another common answer: of course, 'COVID'.", "And Kiwis told Newshub they feel that COVID has made things 'awful', 'difficult', 'unpredictable', 'tough', and 'crap'.", "But never fear everyone, a new year is just three sleeps away.", "Watch the video."]
